entry.title: Reland WebUI: Enforce convention for manifest filenames.
entry.content:
This is a reland of crrev.com/c/4562723



This CL fixes a reference to the outputted manifest file of

merge_js_source_maps().



Prior to this change, some targets output manifests to *.manifest, while

others output to *_manifest.json. This CL conforms all usages

to the latter convention. Notably, ts_library() was changed to output

manifests to ${target_name}_manifest.json by default.



This is the better convention as it preserves the filetype. This has

benefits in the context of highlighting in editors as well as improving

code clarity.



Change-Id: Ie3fc8575a635c591bfc25d14323832025095231f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4576506

Reviewed-by: Demetrios Papadopoulos

Reviewed-by: Mike Dougherty

Commit-Queue: Cole Horvitz

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1151585}

entry.title: Ensure initialization parity between DirtinessState and ShouldSave
entry.content:
TabState and CriticalPersistedTabData have DirtinessState and

ShouldSave respectively to throttle saves and ensure saves don't

get too chatty. It was observed that in some instances the first

CriticalPersistedTabData save was being missed. Upon investigation,

it was determined to be because during TabStateAttributes

initialization DirtinessState was set to DirtinessState.DIRTY without

the equivalent shouldSave being set to true. This CL ensures

parity in that scenario.



Bug: 1450393

Change-Id: I811a48766f571e70769bb629df3e4c4f94fc4280

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4576161

Reviewed-by: Ted Choc

Commit-Queue: David Maunder

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: Allow tabbed web apps to open background tabs
entry.content:
Web apps change the WindowOpenDisposition from NEW_BACKGROUND_TAB to

NEW_FOREGROUND_TAB because of strange behaviour due to not having

tabs. This doesn't make sense for tabbed web apps, so this change

allows them to use the NEW_BACKGROUND_TAB disposition.



Change-Id: I1b41450481063bd0ec55185050b1c470ba8a8209

entry.title: Revert "Shared Storage: Add mojo method for observing response headers"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8313ecff2568a598437132f5f5eaae8636eb13b6.



Reason for revert: Suspected test failures https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/fuchsia-arm64-rel/6790/overview. Cammie asked for the revert after a larger chat.



Original change's description:

> Shared Storage: Add mojo method for observing response headers

>

> We are adding support for writing to Shared Storage from response

> headers. In a later CL, we will add code in the network service to

> parse the response headers. The parsed Shared Storage response headers

> will then be sent to the `StoragePartitionImpl` in the browser process

> via the `network::mojom::URLLoaderNetworkServiceObserverObserver`

> interface. From there, the information from the headers will be

> forwarded to the new `SharedStorageHeaderObserver` class, where, if

> valid, they will trigger calls to actual shared storage operations.

>

> Integration tests will be added in the follow-up CL

> https://crrev.com/c/4519162.

>

> This is part of a project to add support to writing to shared storage

> from response headers. See

> https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/pull/70 for more information

> and https://crrev.com/c/4444068 for a working prototype for `fetch()`.

>

> Fuchsia-Binary-Size: Size increase is unavoidable.

> Bug: 1434529,1218540

> Change-Id: I02cc34eede4dab32360ee09c5e05b02bc96e1325

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4519161

> Reviewed-by: Eric Orth

> Commit-Queue: Cammie Smith Barnes

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1151469}



Bug: 1434529,1218540

Change-Id: Id8e25be6000204c848d2d1d80e6b44ad8b568dfb

No-Presubmit: true

No-Tree-Checks: true

No-Try: true

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4577370

entry.title: multi-display: Update the restore history on updating restore bounds
entry.content:
Going to update the `window_state_restore_history_` every time while

we are updating the window's restore bounds. Then they can be always

kept aligned to avoid getting incorrect restore bounds from the

outdated restore bounds history stack.



Fixed: b/252550835

Change-Id: I0821c9c97ff5709d23d98ba22bdaa31c93c1d005

entry.title: Replace ClientCertType with the signature algorithm list
entry.content:
The client cert type was removed in TLS 1.3. In TLS 1.2, both it and the

signature algorithm list exist. In TLS 1.0 and 1.1, we only have client

cert type.



We no longer support TLS 1.0 and 1.1, so migrate to the new one. This

only impacts Android. On other platforms, we ignore the field anyway.

Android wants key type values as strings, so add a common helper

function to do the conversion. In doing so, this fixes a bug in the

WebView copy, where it used "ECDSA" instead of "EC". This was fixed

in the Chrome copy in https://crrev.com/c/1863377, but I must have

missed that there was a second copy.



Bug: 1270530

Change-Id: Iddc8b0b864bd2b2db54885398f7cf4f2a2352926

entry.content:
There's a regression in M115 where if the user turns the pref false

from WebUI, then closes the tab, and re-opens History, the toggle is

gone.



This regression happened here:

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1450346



This CL is a minimal fix meant to be easily mergeable to M115.

I tested it manually.



A more extensive cleanup can be done after the client-side locale

check can be removed from the code.

entry.title: Revise SQLitePersistentSharedDictionaryStore::RegisterDictionaryResult
entry.content:
This CL stops using absl::optional for `primary_key_in_database` and

`total_dictionary_size` in RegisterDictionaryResult.



RegisterDictionary returns RegisterDictionaryResult only when succeeded

to register a dictionary. So `primary_key_in_database` and

`total_dictionary_size` must be always set.

entry.title: bluetooth: Fix some flaky BluetoothAdapterBlueZ discovery tests
entry.content:
This change rewrites a few BluetoothAdapterBlueZ tests to use futures

rather than arbitrarily spinning the message loop and checking for

expected callback counts. This fixes test flake by making the tests

wait for specific asynchronous events.



One of the particularly flaky patterns fixed here is that

StartDiscoverySession() call does not currently wait for BlueZ to change

the state of the "discovering" property before invoking the callback it

is passed. This means tests also have to wait for the BluetoothAdapter

observer interface to report that the discovering state has changed.

entry.title: Cover `components_unittests` on Rust bots.
entry.content:
Unit tests for the go/rusty-qr-code-generator project are in the

`components_unittests` and therefore this CL adds coverage of this test

suite to the Rust bots.



Because of the https://www.hyrumslaw.com the CL has to modify some unit

tests that depend on the following semi-private aspects of the JSON

parser (which subtly differ on Rust bots):



* Exact shape of JSON error messages

* Threading model (broken by Rust implementation's usage of

`base::ThreadPool` in place of a mojo call):

* Tests no longer can use

`base::test::SingleThreadTaskEnvironment`

* Usage of `base::RunLoop::RunIdle` needs to be refactored away

(note that the comment for this method already says that it

should *not* be used - that `QuitClosure` + `Run` should be

preferred).



Bug: 1431991

entry.title: Update RE2 stance to allow untrusted patterns
entry.content:
As we said in https://crrev.com/c/3209461, we chose to err on the

conservative side until we had more instances where we might need

to deal with untrusted patterns. We've now seen some cases like

that, and looking at how some other teams at Google expose RE2 this

seems like an appropriate risk tradeoff.

entry.title: Remove dangling EditingHandleView ptrs in TouchSelectionControllerImpl.
entry.content:
Rewrite TouchSelectionControllerImpl using UniqueWidgetPtrs to keep

track of EditingHandleView widgets, instead of having raw_ptrs to the

EditingHandleViews. This removes some dangling pointers (and avoids

crashes such as crbug.com/1448682).



Also replace the EditingHandleView dragging_handle_ pointer with a

method TouchSelectionControllerImpl::GetDraggingHandle(). This

determines the handle currently being dragged (if there is one)

using an is_dragging_ property that we add to EditingHandleView.

entry.title: Clear shared dictionaries from BrowsingDataRemoverImpl
entry.content:
This CL introduces NetworkContext.ClearSharedDictionaryCache IPC message

which is called from BrowsingDataRemoverImpl::RemoveImpl() when

DATA_TYPE_COOKIES or DATA_TYPE_CACHE is set in `remove_mask`.



NetworkContext::ClearSharedDictionaryCache() calls

SharedDictionaryManager::ClearData(). This CL implements this method

only in SharedDictionaryManagerOnDisk::ClearData().

SharedDictionaryManagerInMemory::ClearData() will be implemented in the

future.



SharedDictionaryManagerOnDisk serializes the operation of ClearData

using `ClearDataTask` which is a subclass of `SerializedTask`. We will

introduce other types of SerializedTask such as CacheEvictionTask,

ExpiredEntryDeletionTask and MismatchingEntryDeletionTask in the future.



Fuchsia-Binary-Size: Size increase is unavoidable

Bug: 1413922

entry.title: [zlib] Sync with zlib 1.2.13.1, patch 2 of N
entry.content:
Ported:

- Remove K&R function definitions from zlib.



In preparation for the upcoming C2X, as it deprecates K&R

definitions/declarations.



To quote from the proposal: "... because function declarations and

definitions that provide a prototypes are clearly superior we propose to

remove this feature for good."



For further info, see:

https://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg14/www/docs/n2432.pdf

https://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg14/www/docs/n3096.pdf

entry.title: Fix NOTREACHED in app LaunchSource string conversion
entry.content:
When launching an app from chrome://apps, we attempt to convert an

invalid LaunchSource value to a string representation. This invalid

value is created from GetLaunchSourceEnum, which does not account for

a block of missing entries when converting from

extensions::AppLaunchSource to app_runtime::LaunchSource.



We fix this enum mapping so that we don't return invalid values.

entry.title: Incognito Reauth: Extend TabSwitcherCustomViewManager to clear tab list
entry.content:
TabSwitcherCustomViewManager helps to mediate communication from

external clients (re-auth being one of them) to tabswitcher to update

the container view via addCustomView and removeCustomView.



For re-auth when we show the custom view we also clear out any shown

incongito tab list in the grid by listening to onTabModelSelected

and showTabSwitcherView. However, there can an edge case where we

may not clear state when the tabswitcher was already in Incognito and

we are already showing the tabswitcher.



This CL extends the existing API capability to also let the clients

decide whether they would like to clear the tab list when they request

to show the custom view as the tab list can create issues for them.



UX: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1LiqTQWrJiN_IBNB51HPtvvv3J2fXYuA-/view?usp=sharing



Bug: 1445491

enabled cases.

entry.title: Fix rendering order for window controls overlay toolbar.
entry.content:
Having the toolbar be last in paint order was not correct here. While

this did ensure that the toolbar was painted on top of the web contents,

the toolbar still needs to be behind for example the find bar. To make

sure the toolbar is above the web contents only, we move

`top_container_` to be right after the contents view in paint order.

entry.title: Avoid `raw_ptr` hiding in system_dialog_delegate_view.h
entry.content:
The `raw_ptr` variable is hiding the `raw_ptr` type. This is not a

problem in general. Removing it is not useful in general, but it would

make my life easier. Indeed, I am using locally a tweaked version of the

`raw_ptr` class (base::raw_ptr). It becomes a macro and it is used to

automatically list the location of every dangling pointers in Chrome.

Something along the lines of: https://godbolt.org/z/o8adYnc7a



By applying this patch, I won't have to apply this manually anymore.

entry.title: Shared Storage: Add mojo method for observing response headers
entry.content:
We are adding support for writing to Shared Storage from response

headers. In a later CL, we will add code in the network service to

parse the response headers. The parsed Shared Storage response headers

will then be sent to the `StoragePartitionImpl` in the browser process

via the `network::mojom::URLLoaderNetworkServiceObserverObserver`

interface. From there, the information from the headers will be

forwarded to the new `SharedStorageHeaderObserver` class, where, if

valid, they will trigger calls to actual shared storage operations.



Integration tests will be added in the follow-up CL

https://crrev.com/c/4519162.



This is part of a project to add support to writing to shared storage

from response headers. See

https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/pull/70 for more information

and https://crrev.com/c/4444068 for a working prototype for `fetch()`.



Fuchsia-Binary-Size: Size increase is unavoidable.

entry.title: Experiment with caching frequently used KeyedServices
entry.content:
This experiment uses a pointer stored in Profile for a few KeyedServices

that are frequently queried in Chrome. TemplateURLService,

InstantService, and ThemeService are queried thousands of times during

Chrome and having a slightly faster cached pointer may slightly improve

performance in Chrome.



Based on local (linux) builds, getting the KeyedService through this caching mechanism is around 3x faster, and may result in around 1% performance improvement WRT CPU cycles. However, this may be an overstatement based on the configuration of local builds. This may translate to performance on Windows, but it seems unlikely Android relies so heavily on KeyedServices.



Other possible KeyedServices that are queries often are:

extensions::PermissionHelper

extensions::ProcessMap

extensions::ExtensionRegistry



However, these should not be stored in Profile due to layering

violations.



Bug: b/283002660

entry.title: Add enum value for hiberimage not being set up
entry.content:
Add a new enum value to CrosHibernateAbortReason, which

indicates that hibernation was aborted because the

'hiberimage' DM device wasn't set up.



'hiberimage' is set up on the first login after boot, and

torn down when the user logs out. It is currently not set

up again on subsequent logins. The new metric value can

help with understanding how many users are impacted by

this limitation.

entry.title: OOP-VD: Delay the reset() of the StableVideoDecoderFactory.
entry.content:
CL:4538864 made the browser process reset() the

StableVideoDecoderFactory connection once all the StableVideoDecoders

created from it disconnect. When the StableVideoDecoderFactory is

reset(), the remote video decoder process dies. This may cause some

undesired churn if the client creates a StableVideoDecoder, destroys it,

and then creates another StableVideoDecoder. Depending on the timing,

this would end up creating two video decoder processes: the first one to

host the first StableVideoDecoder and the second one to host the second

StableVideoDecoder (and the first process is destroyed). We should be

re-using the same process since the renderer hasn't changed.



This CL accomplishes that by adding a delay before we reset() the

StableVideoDecoderFactory. If all the StableVideoDecoders disconnect but

a request to create another one is received soon after that, we don't

reset() the StableVideoDecoderFactory.



Bug: 1444970, b:195769334

Test: on brya, crosvideo.appspot.com on lacros-chrome while monitoring the task manager and switching between codecs

Test: this CL adds browser tests

entry.title: Revert "[rust] Enable chrome://crash/rust"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8cc6a95b1489275e5040f7e619d2d6faa826f984.



Reason for revert: Suspected cause of tree closure.



Original change's description:

> [rust] Enable chrome://crash/rust

>

> This enables some bytes of Rust in the real Chromium executable for the

> first time. Those bytes are a handler for chrome://crash/rust URIs, and

> thus no Rust will be executed by normal Chrome users. This gives us a

> low-risk opportunity to discover any implications of Rust within Chrome

> and gives us a chance to test out Rust's crash handling.

>

> For now, we're enabling this only on Android and Linux - this condition

> will be relaxed in future.

entry.title: Fix tab switcher handler keeps consuming back event on tablet
entry.content:
mIsTransitionInProgress was introduced to prevent back event from

being consumed by tab navigation during the transition of tab-to-GTS

animation (expand/shrink tabs).



On tablet, a translation replaces that and a back event will cancel

the animation rather than causing the tab to be navigated.



The bug can be triggered when a back gesture is performed during

closing the tab switcher on tablet. The 2nd back event will force

the previous animation to end and assign mIsTransitionInProgress to

false. Then the 2nd back event triggered hideTabSwitcherView again

to assign it to true. But the previous animation has hidden the

tab switcher, postHiding will not be invoked again, leaving

mIsTransitionInProgress being true forever.



Bug: 1449027

Change-Id: I33eb191907a3e9d95abef9e6a9906d63eefeb329

entry.title: Don't enforce attributes for Native GLSurfaces in command decoder
entry.content:
Before this CL validating command decoder did enforce alpha, depth and

stencil attributes for GLSurface that is created from window, e.g

if GLSurface was created with depth or stencil, but client did specify

that it wants no depth, command decoder would enforce that depth isn't

used.



The only code path that still uses native GLSurfaces with command

decoder is WebXR path on Android [1]. We never create real GLSurface

with depth or stencil [2], but unit tests still pretend to use real

surface.



This CL removes the enforcement (so if GLSurface actually has depth

buffer then it can be used) and removes unit tests that verified the

enforcement.



This doesn't change anything for offscreen command buffers.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:components/webxr/mailbox_to_surface_bridge_impl.cc;l=248-263;drc=2425fac374aaa944c34b2340b8f53c9c7fc49533;bpv=0;bpt=1

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:gpu/ipc/service/gles2_command_buffer_stub.cc;l=251-253;drc=2425fac374aaa944c34b2340b8f53c9c7fc49533;bpv=0;bpt=1

This enables some bytes of Rust in the real Chromium executable for the

first time. Those bytes are a handler for chrome://crash/rust URIs, and

thus no Rust will be executed by normal Chrome users. This gives us a

low-risk opportunity to discover any implications of Rust within Chrome

and gives us a chance to test out Rust's crash handling.



For now, we're enabling this only on Android and Linux - this condition

entry.title: Multiplanar: Add GetVideoColorSpace() for various decoders
entry.content:
This change adds GetVideoColorSpace() that returns the color space

set to the CodecPicture for various decoders - av1, h264, h265, vp8

and vp9. It stores the VideoColorSpace within decoder which is then

used for comparison with the new color space set based on preference

between key frame's color space (header) and the container color

space. Upon differences in color space, a ColorSpaceChange is triggered

which recreates picture buffers and in turn recreates shared images.

entry.title: Fixes issue where min framerate might not be fulfilled for
entry.content:
screensharing



The current RequestRefreshFrame (RRF) scheme is very restrictive when

it comes to sending a RRF frame and heavily relies on the using the

default capture stream instead.



It works in normal cases where the client only asks for a refresh at

random (rare) cases, e.g. when starting a stream etc.



However, the current scheme breaks an important case when using

applyConstraints in combination with getDisplayMedia to specify min

and max frame rate. If e.g using min=max=30 (fps), the client expects

to get a *minimum* frame rate of 30 fps. But that is not the case today

if the captured source is static since the default capture stream will

then not send any new frames unless the source has changed. And all

attempts from the client to ask for a refresh will be ignored since

the VDC thinks "I am about to send a default frame soon, hence no need

for an RRF". The only state which today triggers an RRF is if the

default captured frame is very delayed and that is rare.



The new scheme removes the old RRF timer and instead "increases the

priority of refresh frames" by simply converting them into default

capture calls with one important difference; they also ignore the 0Hz

mode and ensures that the captured frame is *always* sent to the

client. This way it is now possible for the client to ask for a certain framerate even for static content. It is not power efficient but it follows the spec.



PS1 This change avoids holding on to a copy of the last captured

frame for potential use as RRF since we know that this can cause

severe cursor flickering.



PS2 I plan to add a new unittest as a follow-up but would like to

fix this ASAP since we break existing clients as is.



Bug: 1421656

entry.title: [ios] Enable content_browsertests
entry.content:
Based on a previous run [1] we still have 240 tests that need to be

skipped so we will add a filter file for these to enable coverage while

these failures are investigated.



Also, following vulkan_swiftshader_content_browsertests, we will force

bot mode to ensure that we can still run parallel jobs (since this

suite can take a long time when run in serial). We also set up

sharding for this suite for more parallelism.



credit: thanks to rohitrao@ for pointing out that BUILD.gn needed to

be updated for the filters to be included.

entry.title: Introduce `ScopedFeatureList::InitWithFeatureStates`
entry.content:

multiple features at a time. The new method simplifies parameterized

unit tests, improves readability and requires less LOC.



This CL also updates ash/ tests to use the new method.

entry.title: Fix support for Cardboard framebuffer scaling
entry.content:
In several cases we were passing the current render target size

to Cardboard APIs that expected the screen dimensions in pixels

instead. Updated so that those APIs always operate on the display

size, which ended up simplifying a couple of code paths.

entry.title: Speak On Mute Opt-in nudge
entry.content:
Implement the anchored nudge for users to opt in or opt out of the

Speak On Mute Detection feature. The nudge attempts to be shown every

time the VC tray visibility changes to true and the mic is muted or the

mic was muted and the tray was visible.



screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5WuAUJpeyX6y4nu



The nudge will not show again if:

- The user interacted with the nudge before.

- The user toggled on the Speak On Mute feature through settings.

- The nudge was shown its max amount of times.



Bug: b:274519463
